title: Electric force - 4Q-4Q at d versus 2Q-2Q at 2d

content.question: Two objects, each with a net charge of <math alttext="4 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>Q</mi></math>, are a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> apart, where <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> is much greater than the size of both objects. At this distance, the objects exert electrostatic forces of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> on each other. Both objects are then given a charge of <math alttext="2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math> and moved to a distance <math alttext="2 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></math> apart. They now exert electrostatic forces of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> on each other. What is <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> in terms of <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction F sub 1 over 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>16</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction F sub 1 over 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>8</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction F sub 1 over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction F sub 1 over 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>16</mn></mfrac></math>
